STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR

Mark Jones
Osceola Youth Center
3030 Long Lane Rd,
Evart, MI, 49639
Re: License #: CI670414130
SI #: 2024SIC0001540
Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
*** This report contains quoted profanity***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024SIC0001540
Special Investigation Intake Date: June 26, 2024
License #: CI670414130
Licensee Group Organization: Youth Opportunity Investments, LLC
Licensee Designee: Tyrene Reginald Green
Chief Administrator: Mark Jones
Agency Name: Osceola Youth Center
Agency Address: 3030 Long Lane Rd
Evart, MI 49639
License Status: 1st Provisional
License Expiration Date: 11/08/2024
Capacity: 16

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/21/24, a staff restrained a youth by picking the youth up and
slamming them into the ground. Youth was also pulled around the
building and punched three times in the stomach by the staff.
Youth had bruises on their stomach that have healed and
currently has a scratch on the top of the left wrist.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 6/26/2024 had
had no further information or concerns.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/1/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
2

reported she and Youth B were not getting along and Youth B was
taken outside the unit by Staff 1. Youth A went to the door and
began yelling out the door to Youth B. Staff 2 was on the unit with
Youth A and followed behind her. Youth A reported Youth B ran
toward her at the doorway and Youth A and Youth B were
punching one another. Staff 2 attempted to restrain Youth A
however Youth A reported she was able to get out of the restraint.
Youth A reported Staff 2 secured Youth A’s arms behind her back
and held her allowing Youth B to hit Youth A. Youth A reported
she swung her body around which caused Staff 2 to swing around
with her. Youth A hit Staff 2 two to three times to get Staff 2 to
release the restraint. Staff 1 and Staff 2 got in between Youth A
and Youth B and separated them by Youth A remaining outside
with Staff 1 and Youth B going into the unit with Staff 2. Youth A
was outside with Staff 1 and remembered the back door was open
and ran around to the back to get into the unit to get Youth B.
Youth A reported Staff 1 followed her and when Youth A got into
the unit and attempted to fight Youth B, Staff 1 placed Youth A in
a restraint and dragged her out of the unit. Once Staff 1 dragged
Youth A out the back door behind the building, Youth A reported
Staff 1 picked Youth A up and slammed Youth A to the ground.
Staff 1 said “don’t hit my staff” and punched Youth A in the
stomach three times. Youth A reported she was on the ground
and Staff 1 was holding her down. Youth A reported she got up
and ran around to the side door to get into the building to get
Youth B. Staff 1 chased Youth A and grabbed her and dragged
her out of the building. Youth A was unable to explain how Staff 1
grabbed and dragged her. Youth A reported she was on the
ground and Staff 1 held her down. Youth A attempted to bite Staff
1 to get him off her. Youth A then grabbed Staff 1’s genitals. Staff
4 came to assist Staff 1. Staff 4 assisted in getting Youth A to
release Staff 1’s genitals. Youth A got up and began throwing
rocks at Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1 ducked to miss getting
hit by the rocks. Youth A reported Staff 1 slammed her to the
ground again and placed his forearm on her neck. Youth A
reported Staff 4 was present and witnessed this. Staff 1 got up
and walked away. Youth A reported she went to the male side of
the facility and climbed the fence attempting to get to Youth B to
fight her. Youth A reported she was restrained by Staff 3 and
Staff 4. Law Enforcement arrived at the facility. Youth A reported
Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E witnessed Staff 1 slam
her to the ground. Youth A reported she was slammed on the
ground three times by Staff 1, once on her side, once on her
stomach, and once in the grass.
3

Youth A reported on a separate incident she went AWOLP
(absent without legal permission) from the facility with Youth F.
Youth A reported she attempted to jump off a bridge and Staff 1
grabbed the back of her shirt and pulled her down. Youth A
reported once she was on the ground, Staff 1 dragged her away
from the bridge. Youth A reported she attempted to get away from
Staff 1 and he grabbed the top part of her body and slammed her
back down on the ground. Youth A reported Staff 1 was on top of
her holding her arms down. Youth A reported Staff 2 and Staff 3
were present when this happened. Youth A reported no youth
were present.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/1/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth B
reported she and Youth A got in a fight. Two female staff
immediately broke up the fight. Youth B reported she was
restrained by Staff 2 and she could not recall which female staff
restrained Youth A. Youth B reported she did not remember Staff
1 being present however recalled a male staff did restrain Youth A
during the incident. Youth B reported the male staff had Youth A’s
arms secured behind Youth A’s back and Youth A was resisting.
Youth B only saw part of the restraint. Youth B reported she
thought “they tackled” Youth A to the ground and described tackle
as pushed Youth A to the ground with their hands on her stomach.
Youth B reported Youth A was on the ground on her stomach and
a staff, unable to recall who, was kneeling on the side of her
holding her arms. Youth B reported she did not remember who
“they” was. Youth B reported no staff slammed Youth A to the
ground or punched Youth A. Youth B reported no other youth
witnessed the incident as the other youth were inside. Youth B
reported the male staff “tackled” Youth A due to Staff 2 not being
able to hold Youth A. Youth B reported she did not see any staff,
including Staff 1, drag Youth A. Youth B reported the male staff
had a cut on his neck from the incident and Staff 2 had a black
eye from Youth A punching her.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/1/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth C
reported Youth B ran up to Youth A and they started fighting.
Staff 2 was present and did not stop Youth A and Youth B from
fighting. Youth C reported Youth A and Youth B fought for fifteen
minutes before Staff 2 intervened. Staff 1 went to assist. Youth C
reported Staff 1 “tackled” Youth A to the ground and described the
tackle as how a football player tackles another football player.
Youth A attempted to punch Staff 1. Staff 1 placed Youth A in a
restraint. Youth C described the restraint as Youth A being on her
4

back on the ground and Staff 1 on top of her. Staff 1 was
straddled over Youth A holding her arms down. Youth C reported
Staff 1 had his hands on Youth A’s neck after he and Youth A fell
to the ground. Youth C reported Staff 1 took his hands off Youth
A’s neck when Youth A pushed Staff 1 off her. Youth C reported
Staff 2 restrained Youth B. Youth C reported it all ended when
law enforcement arrived. Youth C reported she did not see Staff 1
drag or punch Youth A.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/1/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth D
reported she witnessed Youth A and Youth B get into a fight.
Youth D reported staff, she was unable to recall which staff, tried
to break up the fight. Youth D reported Youth A and Youth B were
restrained however could not recall any of the details of the
restraints. Youth D reported Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3 were all
there. Youth D reported no staff hit Youth A or Youth B. Youth D
reported staff were hurt because of the fight and restraints as Staff
1 had a cut on his neck, Staff 2 was hurt but she did not recall
how, and Staff 3 had a bruise on her face from the incident.
Youth E was interviewed via telephone on 7/2/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth E reported she
witnessed a fight between Youth A and Youth B however did not
remember any of the details. Youth E reported Youth A and
Youth B hit, kicked, spit, and bit one another. Youth E reported
staff, unable to recall who, intervened in the fight by placing one of
the youth in a restraint. Youth E did not recall which youth was
restrained. Youth E reported staff acted appropriate, and she did
not witness any staff hit, punch, drag, or slam Youth A or Youth B
to the ground. Youth E did not have any further information to
provide.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/1/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A
and Youth B were in the pod and he and Staff 3 were outside with
Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E near the pavilion. Youth A
opened the door to the pod and there was a call for assistance.
Staff 1 reported he went over to the pod door where Youth A and
Youth B were fighting. Staff 2 initiated a restraint on Youth A
however Youth A hit Staff 2 in the face resulting in Staff 2
releasing Youth A. Staff 1 stepped between Youth A and Staff 2
to prevent Youth A from hitting Staff 2 again. Youth A ran over to
the side building door and got into the pod. Youth A grabbed a
chair to throw at Youth B. Staff 1 used proximity control to keep
Youth A separated from Youth B. Staff 1 reported Youth A began
5

to punch him. Staff 1 placed Youth A in an upper torso restraint.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was resisting the restraint resulting in him
to move with her in the restraint. Staff 1 reported once he was
outside with Youth A he placed her in a seated kneeling upper
torso restraint as Youth A was kicking her legs on the fence.
Youth A began to calm down at which time Staff 1 released Youth
A from the restraint. Staff 1 reported Youth A began to escalate
quickly and kicked him several times. Youth A continued to want
to fight Youth B. Youth A picked up rocks and threw them at Staff
1. Staff 1 reported the rocks were the size of softballs. Staff 1
approached Youth A to grab the rock from her hand and both Staff
1 and Youth A fell to the ground. Staff 1 did not know why or what
caused him and Youth A to fall. Staff 1 reported Youth A fell on
her left side and Staff 1 fell over her with no weight on her. Staff 1
reported Youth A grabbed his testicles and squeezed his testicles.
Staff 1 reported Staff 4 witnessed and came and peeled Youth A’s
hands off his testicles. Staff 1 reported he got up and Staff 4 took
over with Youth A. Staff 1 denied tackling or placing Youth A in a
supine or prone restraint. Staff 1 reported he had a cut on his
right arm and neck from Youth A scratching and/or biting him.
Staff 1 denied having his hand or forearm against Youth A’s neck
or ever choking her, saying “don’t hit my staff”, punching Youth A
in the stomach, rubbing her face in the dirt/gravel, or dragging or
pushing Youth A. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 intervened as soon as
Youth A and Youth B started fighting by trying to place Youth A in
a restraint. Staff 1 reported Youth A was placed in three
restraints, one by Staff 2 when the fight initiated, one by him on
the pod that transitioned to outside, and one by Staff 3 and Staff 4
in the parking lot.
Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth F went AWOLP together a
couple months ago. Youth A and Youth F ran in opposite
directions. Youth A ran to the bridge. Youth A was standing on
the bridge and Staff 1 walked up behind her and lifted her by
having his hands on her sides near her ribs and Staff 2 secured
Youth A in a restraint. Staff 1 reported the restraint was
transitioned into a supine restraint by Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 4.
Staff 1 denied pulling Youth A’s sweatshirt and reported Youth A
was wearing a jacket as it was colder outside. Staff 1 denied
dragging Youth A off the bridge.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 7/18/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she was
working on the girls pod with Staff 1 when Youth A and Youth B
started fighting. Staff 2 reported she attempted to place Youth A
in a standing upper torso restraint however only had Youth A in
6

the restraint for a second when Youth A elbowed her and then hit
her resulting in her releasing the restraint. Staff 1 came to assist.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 were separating Youth A and Youth B by
standing in front of them to keep them away from one another.
Youth A and Youth B went back into the pod and attempted to
throw chairs at one another. Staff 1 reported she was focused on
Youth B and Staff 1 was focused on Youth A. Staff 2 reported she
did not see the restraint Staff 1 placed Youth A in. Staff 2
reported she heard Youth A punch Staff 1 and Staff 1 initiated an
upper torso restraint that ended up outside as Youth A was
moving in the restraint. Staff 2 did not see any of the restraint
outside. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 and Staff 4 were outside with the
other youth from the pod near the pavilion. Staff 2 reported the
youth would not have been able to see the restraint as the
restraint happened outside the back door behind the building.
Staff 2 denied ever seeing Staff 1 punch, tackle, drag, throw,
choke, rub Youth A’s face in the rocks, or Staff 1 have his forearm
anywhere near Youth A’s neck. Staff 2 did not have any concerns
with how Staff 1 handled the situation. Staff 2 reported Youth A
had a scratch near her eye from the fight with Youth B.
Staff 2 reported Youth A went AWOLP in March and ran to a
bridge. Youth A was on the bridge and Staff 4 secured Youth A in
an upper torso restraint. Staff 2 stepped in and took over the
upper torso restraint. Youth A resisted the restraint and was
placed in a supine restraint. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was present
and assisted in the supine restraint. Staff 2 denied Staff 1
dragging Youth A off the bridge. Staff 2 denied Staff 1 being on
top of Youth A and holding Youth A’s arms down.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 7/1/2024
in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she was
called over the radio to assist and did not witness the entire
situation. Staff 3 arrived and was told by Staff 4 to take Youth C,
Youth D, and Youth E outside as the fight between Youth A and
Youth B initially started on the pod. Staff 3 was outside with Youth
C, Youth D, and Youth E. Staff 4 was with Youth A. Youth A ran
to the catwalk out back as she was trying to get to Youth B. Staff
3 reported she and Staff 4 placed Youth A in a two-person seated
upper torso restraint until police arrived. Staff 3 reported she did
not see Staff 1 restrain Youth A. Staff 3 has witnessed Staff 1
restrain youth at the facility and reported no concerns with
restraints she has witnessed him do. Staff 3 reported she had
heard Youth A hit Staff 1 in the head a few times resulting in Staff
1 having a concussion and grabbed Staff 1’s genitals. Staff 3
reported Staff 2 had a black eye from Youth A hitting her.
7

Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 7/10/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and via telephone on
8/13/2024. Staff 4 reported she did not witness the restraint Youth
A was in outside the building. Staff 4 reported she witnessed one
restraint with Staff 1 and Youth A inside the building. Staff 4
reported Staff 1 placed Youth A in a standing upper torso restraint
as Youth A was attempting to go after Youth B. Staff 1 walked with
Youth A in the restraint to the door when Youth A leaned forward
through the door and pushed her feet off the fence. Staff 1
transitioned Youth A into a seated upper torso position. Staff 4
attempted to verbally de-escalate Youth A however Youth A spit
and told Staff 4 to “get out of my face”. Staff 4 reported she left
the area and went to assist in de-escalating Youth B, Youth C,
Youth D, and Youth E. Staff 1 radioed to call law enforcement.
Staff 4 went back to assist Staff 1 and saw Youth A throwing rocks
at Staff 1. Staff 4 returned to continue de-escalation with Youth B,
Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E and Staff 1 radioed for assistance.
Staff 4 went to assist Staff 1 and reported Staff 1 had Youth A in a
supine restraint. Staff 4 reported she had no concerns with the
restraints she witnessed Staff 1 in with Youth A. Staff 4 never saw
Staff 1 punch, slam, drag, have his forearm on Youth A’s throat, or
rub her face in gravel. Staff 4 reported she did an exam on Youth
A following the restraints and Youth A had a few scratches
however she was unsure if that was the result of Youth A climbing
the fence to get to the male side at the facility. Staff 4 reported
Youth B, Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E were near the pavilion
area outside and would not have had line of sight to Staff 1 and
Youth A as they were behind the building and not in view from the
pavilion. Staff 4 reported Youth A approached her a few days ago
and told Staff 4 she would be interviewed regarding the situation
and to say Staff 1 punched her. Staff 4 informed Youth A that she
did not see that happen and would not lie for her.
Staff 4 reported it was difficult to recall the specific incident when
Youth A went AWOLP and ran to the bridge as Youth A has done
that multiple times. Staff 4 was able to recall one incident where
Youth A was standing on the bridge to jump into the river. Staff 4
did not recall who assisted Youth A down from the bridge however
once Youth A was down, Youth A was placed in a hook transport
by Staff 2 and Staff 4. Youth A was transitioned to a supine
restraint as she was resisting by Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3. Staff
4 reported she did not see or recall Staff 1 pulling Youth A’s shirt,
dragging Youth A, or slamming Youth A to the ground. Staff 4
reported Staff 1 was holding Youth A’s arms down while in the
supine restraint. Staff 4 reported she feels Staff 1 could use
8

additional training in verbal de-escalation as she feels he has a
more “aggressive approach” with youth as his prior employment
was in a prison setting. Staff 4 reported she did not have any
concrete examples to provide, she just feels Staff 1’s approach is
more aggressive than necessary.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
7/1/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Administrator
reported there are not video cameras outside the facility.
Administrator reported Staff 1 did initiate the restraint on the pod
which moved to outside. Administrator reviewed the video footage
and had no concerns with the restraint. Administrator had no
concerns with Staff 1 and reported he has no discipline in his
personnel file. Administrator reported Youth A has a pattern of
fighting peers at the facility and a safety plan has been
implemented to keep Youth A separated from peers due to peers
being fearful of Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 6/20/2024 in the pod was reviewed on 7/18/2024.
Youth A walked into the pod. Staff 1 followed Youth A. Youth B
was on the pod throwing chairs and moved out of the camera
view. Youth A attempted to go toward where Youth B had stepped
out of the camera view. Staff 1 got in-between preventing Youth A
from moving closer to where Youth B was off camera. Staff 1 got
Youth A to move toward the door to go outside. Youth A moved
around Staff 1 to move back toward the pod area toward Youth B
who cannot be seen on camera. Staff 1 stood in front of Youth A.
Youth A pushed Staff 1 and punched Staff 1 in the stomach and
began throwing punches at Staff 1. Staff 1 engaged in a standing
upper torso restraint. Youth A pulled away and resisted the
restraint. Staff 1 remained in the upper torso restraint as Youth A
moved out of the camera view toward the door. Staff 4 arrived
seconds before Staff 1 initiated the upper torso restraint and
witnessed the restraint.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on 7/1/2024. It was observed from
the pavilion, the side door to the unit can be seen however the
back door where Staff 1 was in the restraint with Youth A could
not be viewed as it was in the back of the building.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity Osceola Youth Center Safe Crisis
Management and Physical Intervention Policy: Emergency
Physical interventions shall be used only when reasonably
9

necessary to prevent immanent risk of harm to the youth,
self, or others or when there is a serious situation that
places a youth or others at serious threat of violence or
injury if no intervention occurs. Staff directing and applying
physical intervention must be properly trained in DCWL
approved de-escalation and restraint techniques.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Safe Crisis Management
Use of Physical Intervention report for Youth A dated
6/20/2024 completed by Staff 1: Youth A and a peer were
fighting. Youth A and the peer were separated by Staff 1
with verbal commands. Youth A was not following verbal
commands and ran into the unit, grabbed a chair to throw.
Staff 1 prevented Youth A from throwing the chair. Youth A
punched Staff 1 in the chest. Staff 1 placed Youth A in an
upper torso restraint.
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 187070238 dated 6/20/2024 for Youth A was
consistent with Youth Opportunity Investments Safe Crisis
Management Use of Physical Intervention report for Youth
A dated 6/20/2024 completed by Staff 1.
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
Incident Report 187080238 dated 6/20/2024: Staff 3 and
Staff 4 placed Youth A in an upper torso restraint and
transitioned to a seated upper torso restraint as Youth A
was continuing to try to assault Youth B and staff.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Emergency Physical
Assessment for Youth A dated 6/20/2024 completed by
Staff 4: Youth A had multiple superficial abrasions from
being in an altercation with another youth. No marks from
SCM restraint. Youth A had a cut above her left eye,
scratch under left eye, scratches on her abdomen and
back.
• Osceola County Sheriff’s Office Report 67-2401029:
Assault complaint for youth fighting and assaulting staff.
Staff 1’s interview with law enforcement was consistent with
interview in this report. Youth A’s injury to her left eye was
consistent with Youth Opportunity Investments Emergency
Physical Assessment.
• Staff 1 and Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no
disciplinary records. Staff 1 and Staff 2 completed the
required SCM training 10/25/2024-10/27/2024.
• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 176160220 dated 3/2/2024: Youth A went AWOLP.
10

Youth A attempted to jump in front of a car and then
climbed on the side of sears bridge. Staff 4 placed Youth A
into a single person upper torso and Staff 2 took over the
restraint. Youth A was resisting the restraint and making
self-harming statements that she was going to jump off the
bridge and kill herself. Staff 1 went to transition in to take
over the restraint when Youth A dropped her weight on to
Staff 1 and was laying on her back. Youth A was
transitioned into a supine restraint.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance based on interviews with staff
and youth. Youth C, Youth D, and Youth E were outside in the
pavilion and would not have been able to witness the restraint that
occurred behind the building. Interviews with staff indicated Youth
A was not slammed to the ground. Staff 1 indicated at one point
he and Youth A fell to the ground however was unable to explain
what caused the fall. No interviews other than Youth A indicated
Staff 1 dragged Youth A or punched her in the stomach. Youth A
did not indicate anything regarding bruising to her stomach.
CONSULTATION:
It is recommended Administration review Staff 1’s interactions with
youth to determine if addition verbal de-escalation training and/or
other training is necessary.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
8/14/2024
______________________________________
Jennifer Pastorick Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 27, 2024___

Area Manager
11
